results.title: The Dream. The Maskmaker. Youth, maturity, old age, death. The Sideshow.
results.creator_credit: John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Art of silence: pantomimes with Marcel Marceau and his partner Pierre Verry”.
Features Marcel Marceau. “The Dream” presents the idea of dreaming. The Maskmaker” shows the many faces of man. “Youth, Maturity, Old Age, Death symbolically presents the cycle of life beginning with life emerging from the womb through to the grave. “The Sideshow” is a pantomime of circus performers demonstrating their skills.
results.title_for_label: The Dream. The Maskmaker. Youth, maturity, old age, death. The Sideshow.

results.title: Bip as a soldier; The Hands; The Painter.
results.creator_credit: John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Art of silence: pantomimes with Marcel Marceau and his partner Pierre Verry”.
A compilation tape featuring Marcel Marceau, introducing the art of mime through the characater of Bip. “Bip as a soldier” shows the soldier as a tragic and heroic figure. “The Hands” is an allegory of the struggle between good and evil. The serious tone is lightened by the interpretation of “The Painter”.
results.title_for_label: Bip as a soldier; The Hands; The Painter.

results.title: Bip at a society party; Bip hunts butterflies; The Cage
results.creator_credit: John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Art of silence: pantomimes with Marcel Marceau and his partner Pierre Verry”.
Marcel Marceau introduces the art of mime through the character of Bip. “Bip at a society party” portrays many amusing characters encountered at a party. “Bip hunts butterflies” is a tragic comic mime in which Bip discovers how fragile life can be. “The Cage” is an allegorical pantomime of a person struggling to escape from confinement.
results.title_for_label: Bip at a society party; Bip hunts butterflies; The Cage

results.title: The Memphis belle: the story of a flying fortress
results.creator_credit: William Wyler and United States. War Dept.
results.brief_description: The story of the B-17 bomber Memphis Belle on its final mission over Germany to bomb the submarine pens at Wilhelmshaven as told by William Wyler. Shows the 8th Bomber Command air crews being briefed and ground crew preparations. Contains rare wartime footage of actual combat conditions.
results.title_for_label: The Memphis belle: the story of a flying fortress
results.creator_credit_for_label: William Wyler and United States. War Dept.

results.title: Report from the Aleutians
results.creator_credit: John Huston and United States. Army. Signal Corps
results.brief_description: A documentary of life on a lonely airbase on Adak Island in the Aleutians during World War II. For the men of the base, the enemy was the snow, mud, grey skies and boredom punctuated by an occasional bombing raid. John Huston spent six months on the Island and was nearly killed while filming the climactic raid.

results.title: Pearl Harbour December 7th
results.brief_description: A few cameras were on hand to record the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbour on December 7th 1941, film director John Ford’s unit was given the task of recreating many of the major scenes on Hollywood sound stages. Generations of Americans have witnessed the scenes, not realising the attack is actually Ford’s skilful illusion. Historically, the film is accurate in every detail. Winner of the Academy Award for Documentary Production in 1943.

results.title: Time scrambler
results.creator_credit: Pawel Kuczynski, Henriette Simons, H Simons and Landmark Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Reading planet”.
The Time Scrambler has locked five students into a lost time frame. Designed to teach students to use a time line and to recognise sequencing cues in the reading selections. Tells how Prism, an 11 year old alien/teacher instructs his earth students in time sequence when the students become confused about the sequence of events in a story.

results.title: Take heart
results.creator_credit: Penny Cordell, Film and Television Institute (W.A.) and Women's Film Fund AFC
results.brief_description: Western Australia nuclar disarmament protesters tell how they became active protesters against the United States nuclear ships using Coburn Sound. With the help of Dr Helen Caldicott the Nuclear Disarmement Party was formed in 1948 and they campaigned to have Senator Jo Valentine elected to the Australian Parliament. Shows how a small grassroots level group can succed in political ctivity.

results.title: International Monetary System
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Economics”.
An historically detailed understanding of the international monetary system. Covers the Bretton Woods system with its features; role of the US dollar, International Monetary Fund, performance, problems and final collapse. Follows on after Bretton Woods system with the managed float era, pressure and problems, issues and possible reforms to the international monetary system.

results.title: Stock exchange & takeovers
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Economics”.
(HSC economic series) A comprehensive introduction to the stock exchange and takeovers. Covers the reason for having a stock exchange and how it works; buying and selling; how the public is informed; defines takeovers and their motivation; explains how are they made and if they are good or bad for the economy. No other credits available.
